 What is EDI? | EDI/XML | TIE Commerce
 'To take advantage of EDI, business partners (or trading partners) must agree on a standard that will be used for exchanging documents. For example, a business partner might define their Purchase Order as an ANSI X12 850 (EDI Purchase Order), Version 5010. ANSI X12 is the type of EDI, 850 is the EDI business document number, and Version 5010 is the standard edition that the transaction set is based on. EDI Standards are large by nature to give businesses the utmost in flexibility to define the information to be exchanged and most companies only utilize a subset of this information.'
 
 5010: Transitioning to the New Standards
 Unlike with the previous version, 5010 implementation guides, now known as technical reports, are not free. Each report has a list price of $600, or a package of all nine costs $2,500 through Washington Publishing Company, though members of ASC X12 are eligible for discounts of up to 70%.
 
 
 http://www.nextgenpracticesolutions.com/documents/Solutions%20Vol%206%20No%201%20January-February%202009.pdf
 'President Obama has been quoted as saying the following when still President-Elect:
 "…making sure that we're investing in electronic medical records and other technologies that can drive down health care costs. …part of an immediate stimulus package to the economy, but they're also down payments on the kind of long-term, sustainable growth that we need.” 12/07/08
 And the Congress and new Executive Branch have been consistent with these thoughts in their early stages of development. Believing that HIT is a key part of healthcare reform which is a key part of economic reform, the first versions of the Economic Recovery Legislation (stimulus package) include over $20 billion in loans, grants, and incentives to encourage medical providers to adopt automation in their practices. As of this writing, the bill—which has only been released in the House of Representatives as yet—is still in its preliminary stages, but this is what we know so far:
 • Much of the financial support will come in payment incentives once a provider has adopted an automated solution, but grants, loans, and tax incentives for HIT adoption will also be available.'
 
 Ingenix Ingenix.com Homepage - Ingenix.com
 Cuomo had charged Ingenix with posting phony rates in its database, so that a $100 office visit might be reimbursed as a $72 visit, leaving the patient with a bill for the remainder.
 The case started in 2006 when Columbia lecturer Mary Jerome complained she was left with tens of thousands of dollars in bills for ovarian cancer treatment, despite having full insurance.
 Ingenix scandal points to need for database auditors | ZDNet Healthcare | ZDNet.com
 
 An Analysis of Leading Congressional Health Care Bills, 2007-2008: Part I, Insurance Coverage - The Commonwealth Fund
 The Commonwealth Fund commissioned the Lewin Group [1] to estimate the effect of the bills on stakeholder and health system costs and the projected number of people the bills would insure.
 1] The Lewin Group is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ingenix which in turn is owned by UnitedHealth Group. The Lewin Group maintains editorial independence from its owners and is responsible for the integrity of any data that it produces for the Fund.

TriZetto's Newest Facets Version Readies Payers for 5010 Compliance and ICD-10 Migration
 
 'About ANSI x12 Version 5010 Transactions and ICD-10 Code Sets A prerequisite for ICD-10, 5010 transactions define the rules for electronic data transmission of healthcare data such as claims, while the ICD-10 code set provides a much more extensive way to track diagnoses and procedures than its ICD-9 predecessor. Payers must demonstrate their ability to receive HIPAA 5010 transaction in a test environment by January 2011, to move those 5010 transactions into production by January 2012, and able to accept ICD-10 codes by October, 2013.
 
 
 About TriZetto Founded in 1997, TriZetto is the leading privately held healthcare information technology company to the healthcare payer industry. With its technology touching half of the U.S. insured population, TriZetto is Powering Integrated Healthcare Management®, the systematic application of processes and shared information to optimize the coordination of benefits and care for the healthcare consumer. The company's offerings include enterprise and component software, hosting, outsourcing services and consulting that help payers implement and optimize their operations and minimize the risk of bringing to market new products that drive competitive differentiation.'

 1. You do seem convinced that there is a sinster gov't plot. More than an impression. You somehow decided the seemingly innocent wording in the law suggested this.
 2. I explained to you what this actually meant and you dismissed it out of hand. 
 3. None of the information you provided confirms your premise. Some of it contradicts it. Most is not even related. 
 4. Scientists do not "decide beforehand you are sure about something, then go look for information to confirm it. " A hypothesis is the opposite. In fact, the scientific method starts from the null hypothesis, and only when you observe something that falsifies that, do you consider it "true". One collects all data without respect or even knowledge whether it confirms your initial idea. You seem to ignore stuff that doesn't match you initial nutcase premise and keep hunting for something to back you up.
 5. It is up to the person who posits an idea to back it up. It is not my duty to prove your paranoid ideas false. You have failed to make your case.
